result.execSummary:
The defendant Deevin Rashad Bonds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Court waived all non mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.

Complete Batterer's Intervention Program.
Complete a parenting class.
No contact with V.D.W with the exception of third party visitation for the child(ren).
Defendant is advised he/she and may not possess any firearms.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deevin Rashad Bonds

records.addlTxt: Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, filed.

Attorney Ruby De Leon in court, defendant Deevin Rashad Bonds not in court, in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel advises that they are now in a resolution posture. Case adjourned for a Plea/Sentencing hearing to Br 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Ruby De Leon in court, defendant Deevin Rashad Bonds not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Parties are still negotiating and requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 8-16-22 at 8:30 am for status conference by zoom.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Helmi Hamad in court, defendant Deevin Rashad Bonds not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Attorney Hamad is withdrawing bail review motion.  Case remains scheduled for pretrial conference on 7-22-22 at 8:30 am.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with VDW (12/29/87).

Defendant Deevin Rashad Bonds in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Deevin Rashad Bonds in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deevin Rashad Bonds appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that due to the intake calendar of the week, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
